abstract: Structure containing details about a business.
overview:
## Overview

This structure and its supporting types correspond to the “chatbot” JSON schemas defined by the RCS specification.

To get information about a business, use the [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/CellularServiceID] and [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSHandle] from an [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSMessage] you receive in the RCS service’s [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSService/incomingMessageNotifications], then call [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSService/businessInformation(for:)] on the RCS service, which returns an instance of the `Business` type.

Your app receives [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSService/Business/Card] and [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSService/Business/CardCarousel] instances as cases of the [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSMessage/Content-swift.enum] enumeration in messages received from the RCS service’s [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSService/incomingMessageNotifications] asynchronous sequence. Use the properties of the received cards to display content sent from the business to the person using your app.

An [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSService/IncomingMessageNotification] instance may contain [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSService/Business/Suggestion] instances in its [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSService/IncomingMessageNotification/suggestions] array. These suggestions can include a [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSService/Business/SuggestedAction] or a [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSService/Business/SuggestedReply]. Act on these, then call [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSService/sendSuggestionResponse(_:)] on the RCS service.

source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSService/Business
crawled: 2025-12-05T10:48:34Z

# RCSService.Business

**Structure**

Structure containing details about a business.

## Declaration

```swift
struct Business
```

## Overview

This structure and its supporting types correspond to the “chatbot” JSON schemas defined by the RCS specification.

To get information about a business, use the [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/CellularServiceID] and [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSHandle] from an [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSMessage] you receive in the RCS service’s [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSService/incomingMessageNotifications], then call [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSService/businessInformation(for:)] on the RCS service, which returns an instance of the `Business` type.

Your app receives [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSService/Business/Card] and [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSService/Business/CardCarousel] instances as cases of the [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSMessage/Content-swift.enum] enumeration in messages received from the RCS service’s [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSService/incomingMessageNotifications] asynchronous sequence. Use the properties of the received cards to display content sent from the business to the person using your app.

An [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSService/IncomingMessageNotification] instance may contain [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSService/Business/Suggestion] instances in its [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSService/IncomingMessageNotification/suggestions] array. These suggestions can include a [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSService/Business/SuggestedAction] or a [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSService/Business/SuggestedReply]. Act on these, then call [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSService/sendSuggestionResponse(_:)] on the RCS service.

## Accessing business identity information

- **description**: Description for business.
- **providerName**: Name of business provider.
- **organizationNames**: Array of names specified by business.
- **RCSService.Business.OrganizationName**: Structure containing details about a business’ name.
- **categoryNames**: Array of category names which can be used to filter a list of businesses.

## Accessing business contact information

- **communicationAddress**: Communication details of business.
- **RCSService.Business.CommunicationAddress**: Structure containing a business’ communication details.
- **addressEntries**: Array of business’ address locations.
- **RCSService.Business.AddressEntry**: Structure containing address details provided by a business.
- **emailAddress**: Service email address.
- **websiteURL**: URL for business’ website.
- **verificationDetails**: Verification information about business.
- **RCSService.Business.VerificationDetails**: Structure containing verification details of a business.

## Accessing terms and conditions

- **termsAndConditionsURL**: URL for business’ terms and conditions.

## Accessing display information

- **themeColor**: Theme color to apply to conversation view.
- **backgroundImageURL**: Background image to apply to business information page.
- **styleSheetTemplateURL**: URL referring to a CSS template to be used in rich cards sent by business.
- **persistentMenu**: Persistent menu with a nested collection of suggested replies and suggested actions.
- **RCSService.Business.Menu**: A menu provided by business.

## Accessing media entries

- **mediaEntries**: Media entries provided by business.
- **RCSService.Business.MediaEntry**: Structure containing media details provided by a business.

## Accessing version information

- **version**: Version of contents.

## Supporting types

- **RCSService.Business.Card**: Structure representing a standalone card.
- **RCSService.Business.CardCarousel**: Structure representing a card carousel.
- **RCSService.Business.ComposeRecordingAction**: Compose a draft message with a media recording.
- **RCSService.Business.ComposeTextAction**: Compose a draft text message.
- **RCSService.Business.CreateCalendarEventAction**: Structure representing an action to create a calendar event.
- **RCSService.Business.DialPhoneNumberAction**: Suggested action to dial a phone number.
- **RCSService.Business.Media**: Structure containing media information provided by a business.
- **RCSService.Business.OpenURLAction**: Suggested action to open a URL.
- **RCSService.Business.ShowLocationAction**: Shows a location on a map.
- **RCSService.Business.SuggestedAction**: Suggested action sent by a business.
- **RCSService.Business.SuggestedReply**: Suggested reply in response to a business message.
- **RCSService.Business.TelephoneDetails**: Structure containing the telephone number details provided by a business.
- **RCSService.Business.URIEntry**: Structure containing details of a URI provided by a business.

## Enumerations

- **RCSService.Business.Suggestion**: Enumeration representing a suggestion from a business.

## Retrieving business information

- **businessInformation(for:)**: Requests business information for a specified handle.
- **RCSService.BusinessInformationRequest**: A structure representing a request to retrieve information about a business.

## Conforms To

- Decodable
- Encodable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
